content: training wheels is a simple but warm and squishy cowl it is made entirely in two-color brioche stitch so it is great for brioche beginners who want to practice practice practice their new skills because of the brioche the cowl is reversible where each side is the opposite of the other pick two colors that you love and wear it both ways this cowl is knit from the bottom up **finished measurements** height 12 / 38cm circumference 23 / 58cm **materials** *yarn* two skeins in contrasting colors of one of the following worsted-weight yarns * shepherd s wool worsted stonehedge fiber mill 100% merino 250 yards/229 meters * vintage berroco 52% acrylic 40% wool 8% nylon 217 yards/198 meters * rios malabrigo 100% superwash merino 210 yards/192 meters the purple sample uses shepherd s wool in colorways plum and lilac and the green sample uses berroco vintage in colorways mistletoe and smoke *needles* 16 circular needles in size us 8 / 5 mm and us 10 / 6 mm or size needed to obtain gauge *notions* stitch marker tapestry needle for weaving in ends
